newsitem.title: USA: NHL ICE HOCKEY-GRANATO, FETISOV SPECIAL SELECTIONS TO WEST ALL-STAR TEAM.
newsitem.headline: NHL ICE HOCKEY-GRANATO, FETISOV SPECIAL SELECTIONS TO WEST ALL-STAR TEAM.

text.p: Left wing Tony Granato of San Jose and Detroit defenceman Viacheslav Fetisov were added to the Western Conference All-Star roster Tuesday as special selections by NHL Commissioner Gary Bettman.
The 32-year-old Granato will be making his All-Star debut at the January 18 game at San Jose, while Russian Fetisov, 38, adds the All-Star honour to a long list of achievements.
Granato has made an inspirational comeback to the NHL after undergoing brain surgery last February to remove an abnormal collection of blood vessels.

Granato, who missed the Los Angeles Kings' final 32 games of the 1995-96 season, signed as a free agent with the Sharks in August. The nine-year veteran recorded a hat trick in the second game of the season and ranks second on the Sharks with 12 goals in 38 games.

"The dedication and perseverance shown by Tony Granato in his remarkable comeback is certainly of All-Star calibre," said Bettman. "His addition to the Western Conference All-Star team is well deserved."

Fetisov is playing in his eighth NHL season. The Moscow native made his NHL debut with the New Jersey Devils in 1989-90 after a much-decorated 15-year career in Soviet hockey which included participation in 11 world championships and three Olympics. Fetisov joined the Red Wings in April 1995.

"Slava Fetisov's tremendous accomplishments in a career that spans over 20 years in Europe and North America make him a worthy addition to the Western Conference All-Star team," said Bettman. "His talent and leadership abilities have made him one of the most respected figures in hockey."
Players named to the Eastern Conference All-Star team as Commissioner selections will be announced Wednesday.
